preprocessed_description: Job Level: RE-05 $68,641 to $91,072 (salary under review) Closing Date: 04/02/24 INTERMEDIATE PROGRAMMER / ANALYST The Corporate Services Branch is looking for an Intermediate Programmer / Analyst for an indeterminate position. The position is classified as a RÉ-05 ($68,641 to $91,072 per annum). Salary under review. ABOUT US The National Capital Commission (NCC) is the federal Crown corporation dedicated to ensuring that Canada's Capital is a dynamic and inspiring source of pride for all Canadians and a legacy for generations to come. Building on more than a century of experience, the NCC provides unique value in the Capital Region by fulfilling three specific roles: long-term planner of federal lands, principal steward of nationally significant public places, and creative partner committed to excellence in development and conservation. Year after year, the NCC has been recognized as one of National Capital Region's top employers. NCC employees can deploy to departments and separate agencies in accordance with the Public Service Employment Act. A list of qualified people will be compiled and may be used for additional temporary or indeterminate positions. JOB OVERVIEW Reporting to the Team Leader, Data Management, you will be responsible for the analysis, design, development, quality assurance, implementation, and support services for reporting/ Business Intelligence (Business Intelligence) solutions, including managing the data warehouse and application software. This job requires a blend of business analysis and business processes knowledge, combined with strong structured query language (Structured Query Language) scripting, troubleshooting, programming, technical and analytical skills. You will provide technical advice, application assistance and deliver training sessions to technical colleagues as well as the users of new IT solutions. ESSENTIAL QUALIFICATIONS: EDUCATION A degree from a recognized post-secondary institution in the field of Information Technology or in a related discipline to the position. EXPERIENCE Three (3) to five (5) years of experience in each of the following areas: Working with Structured Query Language Server 2012 (or newer), Structured Query Language Server Reporting Services and Structured Query Language Server Integration Services; Writing complex Structured Query Language and C# (C Sharp) scripts; Designing and developing data analytics reports using tools such as Power Business Intelligence, Tableau or Structured Query Language Server Analysis Services. KNOWLEDGE Of Online Transaction Processing (OLTP) Relational Databases and Online Analytical Processing (OLAP) Enterprise Data Warehouse design, development and administration; Of database security concepts; Of web and desktop (MS Windows) development concepts and programming languages; Of business analysis and processes. ABILITIES To analyze, troubleshoot and resolve complex programming and technical issues; To work with clients to define and document user requirements; To follow appropriate and structured programming methodology for delivering solutions; To write, maintain and present technical documentation such as architecture designs, reports, specifications, system configurations and user guides COMPETENCIES Demonstrating Integrity and Respect Civility and Well-Being. Thinking things through - Innovating through analysis and ideas. Working Effectively with Others – Relationships and Trust Building. Showing Initiative and Being Action-Oriented – Getting Things Done. ASSETS Knowledge of the DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) library of functions; Knowledge of Power Query / M language; Knowledge of corporate applications such as Microsoft Dynamics AX (Enterprise Resource Planning), Microsoft Customer Relationship Management and PeopleSoft; Knowledge of Visio or other tools for Entity Relationship Diagram design, system architecture design, application design and use case scenarios documentation; Knowledge in the use and development of Web services, Representational State Transfer APIs; Knowledge and experience in the field of financial operations, asset management and general business administration. CONDITIONS OF EMPLOYMENT Possess or eligible to obtain Secret security clearance. Linguistic profile: Bilingual BBB; Position is in the National Capital Region. The person selected for this position must reside within a commutable distance from the workplace at 40 Elgin Street, Ottawa, Ontario; The National Capital Commission offers a hybrid and flexible work environment, all employees are currently asked to work on-site at least two (2) days per week. The NCC is committed to establishing and maintaining a representative workforce. Qualified applicants who self-declare as members of a visible minority group, Indigenous peoples, persons with disabilities and/or women may be selected for appointment to fulfill organizational needs. The NCC is also committed to developing inclusive, barrier-free selection processes and work environments. If contacted regarding this competition, please advise the Human Resources representative of the accommodation measures which must be taken to enable you to be assessed in a fair and equitable manner. If you require additional information on the position or if you are experiencing technical difficulties, please contact us at hr.recruitment@ncc-ccn.ca. Hearing impaired and speech impaired persons can contact us through a Teletype Device (TTY) at (613) 239-5090 or 1-866-661-3530 (toll free). Please take note that only selected candidates will be contacted.
